If all characters in the game were roughly equal, would that make the 
game more interesting or less interesting?  I'd say less interesting.

As powerfull as mages and archmages are, they both have a very strong 
weakness: faeries.  Clerics are next in line for strength, what are 
their weaknesses?  They can only summon new characters if you left 
blood stains on a scenario or some character has died.  

What about Druids, Thieves, and Elves?  Druids can summon the faeries 
that are the achilles heal of mages/archmages.  Thieves can turn 
invisible and keep attacking you, making them worthy opponents.  Elves 
can run into a forest and recooperate health without much fear of 
being attacked.  Ghosts can be used to chase away your opponents, 
while skeletons are near impossible to hit because of their speed and 
tunneling ability.  I could go on about every character being roughly 
equal if you exclude a few.  Each of those few has a weakness in their 
powers.

I am tempted, when I finish my set of scenarios, to send a 100% 
legitimate team with a lot of characters through most available 
scenarios.
